Database API 1.5.1

SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

com.google.code.gwt.database.client.service
Annotation Type Update

@Documented
@Target(value=METHOD)
public @interface Update

Provides the SQL update statement to be executed when the annotated method is called. This annotation mandates a read/write transaction.

Provide any statement parameters between curly braces, e.g.: 

 @Update("INSERT INTO mytable (when, name) VALUES({when.getTime()}, {name})")
 void insertData(Date when, String name, VoidCallback callback);

Collection input parameters

The SQL annotation can also be used to repeat a SQL statement for each item in an Iterable collection or an Array. This mechanism is expressed like this: 

 @Update(sql="INSERT INTO mytable (when, name) VALUES ({_.getTime()}, {name})",
     foreach="dates")
 void insertData(Iterable<Date> dates, VoidCallback callback);

The important parts are emphasized in bold. The above specification is translated to Java like this: 

 for (Date _ : dates) {
   tx.executeSql("INSERT INTO mytable (when, name) VALUES (?, ?)",
       new Object[] {_.getTime(), name});
 }

Return values

An INSERT statement returns information about the ID of an inserted record. Use the RowIdListCallback callback to get the inserted ROWID's: 

 @Update(sql="INSERT INTO mytable (when, name) VALUES ({_.getTime()}, {name})",
     foreach="dates")
 void insertData(Iterable<Date> dates, RowIdsCallback callback);

The iterated statements are all executed within the same database transaction.

SQL dialect

Up to now (oct. 2009) all HTML5 Database implementations use SQLite, which has its own SQL flavor.

See Also:
SQLite3 SQL Language Reference

Optional Element Summary
 String foreach
          Represents a Collection of items, over which the service method will iterate.
 String sql
          Represents the SQL statement to execute.
 String value
          Represents the SQL statement to execute.
 

value

public abstract String value
Represents the SQL statement to execute. Either this attribute or sql() must be specified.

Default:
""

sql

public abstract String sql
Represents the SQL statement to execute. Either this attribute or value() must be specified.

Default:
""

foreach

public abstract String foreach
Represents a Collection of items, over which the service method will iterate. This attribute is optional.

Default:
""
